abstract.p: Jean-Maurice Moulene paints watercolors of homes of wealthy residents of Los Angeles (Currents); drawing (S)

block.p: Architectural students of the Ecole des Beaux-Arts used to travel to Rome and Greece to draw great antiquities. Jean-Maurice Moulene, a Beaux-Arts trained French architect, gives the classical treatment to homes of gilded Angelenos, including movie producers. Many of Mr. Moulene's clients own multiple trophy homes. ''When they go stay in Colorado they like to have a picture of their house in L.A.,'' he said. Watercolors like the one below start at $1,200, depending on the complexity and size of the rendering, usually 11 by 17 inches. Information: (888) 320-9814.
